Section_A.directions: In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

options.A: Annoyed.
options.B: Scared.
options.C: Confused.
options.D: Offended.

options.A: It crawled over the woman’s hands.
options.B: It wound up on the steering wheel.
options.C: It was killed by the police on the spot.
options.D: It was covered with large scales.

options.A: A study of the fast-food service.
options.B: Fast food customer satisfaction.
options.C: McDonald’s new business strategies.
options.D: Competition in the fast-food industry.

options.A: Customers’ higher demands.
options.B: The inefficiency of employees.
options.C: Increased variety of products.
options.D: The rising number of customers.

options.A: International treaties regarding space travel programs.
options.B: Legal issues involved in commercial space exploration.
options.C: U.S. government’s approval of private space missions.
options.D: Competition among public and private space companies.

options.A: Deliver scientific equipment to the moon.
options.B: Approve a new mission to travel into outer space.
options.C: Work with federal agencies on space programs.
options.D: Launch a manned spacecraft to Mars.

options.A: It is significant.
options.B: It is promising.
options.C: It is unpredictable.
options.D: It is unprofitable.

Section_B.directions: In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

options.A: Visiting her family in Thailand.
options.B: Showing friends around Phuket.
options.C: Swimming around a Thai island.
options.D: Lying in the sun on a Thai beach.

options.A: She visited a Thai orphanage.
options.B: She met a Thai girl’s parents.
options.C: She learned some Thai words.
options.D: She sunbathed on a Thai beach.

options.A: His class will start in a minute.
options.B: He has got an incoming phone call.
options.C: Someone is knocking at his door.
options.D: His phone is running out of power.

options.A: He is interested in Thai artworks.
options.B: He is going to open a souvenir shop.
options.C: He collects things from different countries.
options.D: He wants to know more about Thai culture.

options.A: Buying some fitness equipment for the new gym.
options.B: Opening a gym and becoming personal trainers.
options.C: Signing up for a weight-loss course.
options.D: Trying out a new gym in town.

options.A: Professional personal training.
options.B: Free exercise for the first week.
options.C: A discount for a half-year membership.
options.D: Additional benefits for young couples.

options.A: The safety of weight-lifting.
options.B: The high membership fee.
options.C: The renewal of his membership.
options.D: The operation of fitness equipment.

options.A: She wants her invitation renewed.
options.B: She used to do 200 sit-ups every day.
options.C: She knows the basics of weight-lifting.
options.D: She used to be the gym’s personal trainer.

Section_C.directions: In this section, you will hear three passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

options.A: They tend to be nervous during interviews.
options.B: They often apply for a number of positions.
options.C: They worry about the results of their applications.
options.D: They search extensively for employers’ information.

options.A: Get better organized.
options.B: Edit their references.
options.C: Find better-paid jobs.
options.D: Analyze the searching process.

options.A: Provide their data in detail.
options.B: Personalize each application.
options.C: Make use of better search engines.
options.D: Apply for more promising positions.

options.A: If kids did not like school, real learning would not take place.
options.B: If not forced to go to school, kids would be out in the streets.
options.C: If schools stayed the way they are, parents were sure to protest.
options.D: If teaching failed to improve, kids would stay away from school.

options.A: Allow them to play interesting games in class.
options.B: Try to stir up their interest in lab experiments.
options.C: Let them stay home and learn from their parents.
options.D: Design activities they now enjoy doing on holidays.

options.A: Allow kids to learn at their own pace.
options.B: Encourage kids to learn from each other.
options.C: Organize kids into various interest groups.
options.D: Take kids out of school to learn at first hand.

options.A: It is especially popular in Florida and Alaska.
options.B: It is a major social activity among the young.
options.C: It is seen almost anywhere and on any occasion.
options.D: It is even more expressive than the written word.
